result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquis L Waskow in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin Nagy in court for Marquis L Waskow.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. CT orders defn discharged from the commitment and orders proceeding to continue. Bail cont.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: of Commitment

Defendant Marquis L Waskow in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin Nagy in court for Marquis L Waskow.  Attorney Annie Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Engen's report concludes defn does not meet the standards for legal competency but is more than likely able to regain competency with Tx. Colloquy w/ Atty Nagy. Colloquy w/ defn; Defn agrees with the Doctor's report. Counsel do not wish to present evidence contrary to the doctor's findings. CT makes findings and finds defn is not competent but is likely able to become restored to competency within the statutory time period. Defn contests the commitment order be with an order to treat. Defn advised will voluntary take medications. CT makes findings and orders defn committed to the dept and the CT orders the commitment and transport to commence f/w. CT signs order f/w. CT orders proceedings suspended.
Completed by Dr. Engen
Atty Nagy appointed
Copy of minutes from IA Hrg on 7/25/22 sent electronically to DCJ. Copy of order for competency exam sent electronically to DCJ and Dane County Conditional Release Program.
by DHS
for competency exam
Competency hearing on August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not be at PACT program except only for legitimate medical purposes. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

02:38 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Allegra L Berry.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
PSA Report
